intro: Guioa novoebudaensis, commonly known as the Newebuda Guioa, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
